page.title: 05AGRICULTURE
page.content: In 1985 most of the 1200 hectares of this block are under crops. Wheat and barley occupy about 25% each.In the last 6 years there has been a marked increase in the growing of oil seed rape, which with oats, peas and beans make up abouut 15%.The remaining 35% is mainly grass, some of it temporary ley, some permanent pasture, some improved and a little rough grazing.Most grass remains in the Ouse floodplain or in small fields left by old-time farmers.Whereas in 1931 most of the farming was mixed with quite a large proportion of animals, especially sheep,dairy and beef cattle, whilst most families had two pigs for their own use,now a lot of grazing has been ploughed up and only a few specialised flocks and herds remain. Many hedges have been removed to make large arable plots.
